title: Thieves Steal Napoleon's Necklace, Artifacts from Louvre in Daylight Heist
snippets: French Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez called the heist "a major, highly organized operation" that lasted just seven minutes. Authorities were still drawing up the value of the stolen items.
Thieves rob priceless jewels from Paris' Louvre in brazen heist Reuters
Thieves steal crown jewels in 4 minutes from Louvre Museum AP News
The world's most-visited museum will remain closed for the day for 'exceptional reasons'.
Robbers drop imperial crown but succeed to flee with 8 other artefacts, says prosecutor
Thieves used an extendable ladder and motorbikes to steal eight precious items from Apollo's Gallery at Paris museum.

Necklace given by Napoleon to his wife among items taken from Paris museum in highly professional daylight raid French police are hunting four thieves who carried out a highly professional daylight raid on the Louvre, breaking into one of the museum’s most ornate rooms and escaping with eight pieces
The robbers employed a portable electric ladder to break into a second-floor wing of the Paris museum that holds the French crown jewels.
What jewels did the Louvre thieves target? Reuters
titles: Masked thieves steal 'priceless' jewels from the Louvre Museum
Thieves rob priceless jewels from Paris' Louvre in brazen heist - Reuters
Thieves steal crown jewels in 4 minutes from Louvre Museum - AP News
‘Priceless’ jewels stolen from France’s Louvre Museum in four-minute heist
French police on manhunt after thieves steal royal jewels from Louvre
Four-minute heist at the Louvre: How priceless jewels were stolen in France
Louvre heist: hunt on for thieves after eight ‘priceless’ jewellery pieces stolen
Louvre Robbers Take ‘Priceless’ French Jewels
What jewels did the Louvre thieves target? - Reuters
summary: In a highly organized heist at Paris' Louvre Museum, four thieves used an extendable ladder to access the Apollo's Gallery, stealing eight precious artifacts in just seven minutes. Among the stolen items was a necklace given by Napoleon to his wife. Despite dropping an imperial crown during their escape, the thieves successfully fled the scene on motorbikes. The Louvre, the world's most-visited museum, closed for the day following the incident. French police are actively searching for the culprits behind this audacious daylight robbery. The total value of the stolen items is still being assess

title: Commanders QB Daniels Injured, Out After Sack Against Cowboys
snippets: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels suffered a right hamstring injury early in the third quarter against the Dallas Cowboys on Sunday and was later ruled out, yet another blow to a banged-up Washington offense.
Daniels was able to limp off but was in clear pain
The Commanders quarterback left in the third quarter with a hamstring injury.
The Commanders quarterback was injured on a third-quarter sack.

Washington Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels left Sunday’s game against the Dallas Cowboys with a hamstring injury after having his right leg turned awkwardly when being sacked and losing a fumble midway through the third quarter.
titles: Commanders lose QB Daniels to hamstring injury
Jayden Daniels injury: Commanders star quarterback hurts hamstring in blowout loss to Cowboys
Cowboys win big, 44-22, as Commanders lose Jayden Daniels
Commanders rule out Jayden Daniels with hamstring injury
Commanders QB Jayden Daniels exits with hamstring injury vs. Cowboys
summary: Washington Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels sustained a right hamstring injury after an awkward fall during a sack in the third quarter against the Dallas Cowboys. He left the game visibly in pain and was ruled out, further impacting the already injured Washington offense.

title: Springer Back in Blue Jays Lineup for ALCS Game 6 Against Mariners
snippets: Blue Jays slugger George Springer is in the starting lineup for Game 6 of the American League Championship Series against the Mariners on Sunday night.
George Springer is back in the Toronto Blue Jays' lineup.
The Blue Jays send Trey Yesavage to the mound looking to force a Game 7 against the Mariners. Watch Game 6 of the ALCS on Sportsnet and follow the action using the MLB Live Tracker.
The Toronto Blue Jays will get a boost ahead of a must-win Game 6 of the American League Championship Series, with George Springer set to play Sunday against the Seattle Mariners.
Watch as Toronto Blue Jays’ Daulton Varsho speaks to the media ahead of a pivotal Game 6 of the ALCS against the Seattle Mariners.

George Springer is “feeling better” ahead of the most important game of the Toronto Blue Jays’ post-season. Blue Jays manager John Schneider said that Springer was recovering quickly after taking a fastball off the inside of his right knee in Game 5 of the American League Championship Series. Toront
Will Seattle punch its ticket to the World Series, or will Toronto force a Game 7?
titles: Springer in starting lineup as Jays face must-win
Springer in Blue Jays’ lineup for Game 6
ALCS on Sportsnet: Blue Jays vs. Mariners, Game 6
Blue Jays’ George Springer in lineup for Game 6 of ALCS

summary: George Springer has returned to the Toronto Blue Jays' starting lineup for Game 6 of the American League Championship Series (ALCS) against the Seattle Mariners, following a quick recovery from a knee injury sustained in Game 5. The Blue Jays, with Trey Yesavage as their pitcher, aim to extend the series by winning this must-win game. The match is available for viewing on Sportsnet and can be followed using the MLB Live Tracker.

title: US Strikes Ships in Caribbean, Sparks Feud with Colombia
snippets: The move is the latest in a string of escalations from the US which has struck at least six ships in the Caribbean Sea in recent weeks.
Petro calls Trump "rude and ignorant about Colombia" a day after he demanded answers about US strikes in Caribbean.

The US president has accused his Colombian counterpart Gustavo Petro of condoning the production of drugs headed for the US. Colombia, meanwhile, has said the US violated its sovereignty and killed a fisherman.
Gustavo Petro had earlier accused administration of murder over its attacks on vessels in the Caribbean

Trump vows to cut US funding as Pete Hegseth says US hit Colombian rebel group vessel and ‘three terrorists killed’ Donald Trump on Sunday accused Colombia’s president, Gustavo Petro, of being an “illegal drug dealer” and threatened to immediately cut US funding to the country, as a Republican senat
Trump Cuts Off US Aid to Colombia, Calls Petro ‘Drug Leader’ Bloomberg.com

PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — The United States will slash assistance to Colombia because its leader, Gustavo Petro, “does nothing to stop” drug production, President Donald Trump said Sunday, escalating the friction between Washington and one of its closest allies in Latin America. In a social media post
The feuding reflected rising tensions in Latin America over U.S. attacks in the Caribbean. President Trump’s administration had already slashed aid to Colombia this year.
titles: Trump ends aid to Colombia and calls country's leader a 'drug leader'
Trump calls Colombia’s Petro ‘a drug leader’, says US to cut aid to country
Trump ends Colombia aid over drug boom as Colombia accuses US of violating sovereignty
Trump calls Colombia president a ‘drug leader’ and vows to end US funding
Trump calls Colombia president ‘illegal drug dealer’ as US says it hit another ship
Trump Cuts Off US Aid to Colombia, Calls Petro ‘Drug Leader’ - Bloomberg.com
Trump calls Colombia’s Petro an ‘illegal drug leader’ and announces an end to US aid to the country
Colombia’s Leader Accuses U.S. of Murder, Prompting Trump to Halt Aid
summary: The US has escalated tensions with Colombia by striking at least six ships in the Caribbean Sea, leading to a public feud between President Trump and Colombian President Gustavo Petro. Trump accused Petro of condoning drug production and being an "illegal drug dealer," subsequently cutting US aid to Colombia. Petro criticized Trump as "rude and ignorant" and accused the US of violating Colombian sovereignty and killing a fisherman. The conflict reflects broader tensions over US actions in Latin America.

title: Florida, Colorado State Dismiss Football Coaches Amid Poor Starts
snippets: Florida fired head coach Billy Napier with the Gators off to a 3-4 start this season. He was 22-23 in four seasons and will be owed roughly $21 million.
Norvell went just 18-26 during his time at CSU
Florida will seek to hire its fourth football coach in 11 years
Colorado State Fires Coach Jay Norvell After 2-5 Start to Season Sports Illustrated

Florida fired coach Billy Napier on Sunday, dumping him a day after an error-filled win against Mississippi State that included more head-scratching calls and offensive lulls like those that marked much of his four-year run with the Gators.
titles: Florida fires coach Napier after 3-4 start in '25
Colorado State fires Jay Norvell: Rams move on from fourth-year coach after 2-5 start
Florida fires Billy Napier: Gators part with fourth-year coach amid disappointing 3-4 start to 2025 season
Colorado State Fires Coach Jay Norvell After 2-5 Start to Season - Sports Illustrated
Florida fires coach Billy Napier after four-year run that ends with 22-23 record
summary: Florida fired head coach Billy Napier after a 3-4 start this season, marking his overall record at 22-23 over four years. He will receive about $21 million. Similarly, Colorado State dismissed coach Jay Norvell following a 2-5 start. This marks Florida's pursuit of its fourth football coach in 11 years, reflecting ongoing changes in leadership for both universities' football programs.

title: Israel Strikes Gaza in Response to Alleged Militant Attack; Ceasefire Holds
snippets: Israel said Sunday it responded after "terrorists" attacked troops operating in the Rafah area with gunfire and an anti-tank missile. Hamas said it was unaware of the clashes.
Hamas maintains it is abiding by ceasefire as Israel launches at least 20 air strikes on targets in southern Gaza.
Israel launched a wave of attacks on Gaza after accusing Palestinian militants of attacking its forces across cease-fire lines. Both sides say they are still committed to the truce.
The Israeli Defense Forces said it struck “dozens” of targets in Gaza, about one week after the ceasefire went into effect.
titles: Israel strikes Gaza as both Israel and Hamas accuse each other of breaching ceasefire
Israeli strikes kill 42 in Gaza as both sides say the other breached truce
Israel Strikes Gaza and Temporarily Halts Aid, Saying Hamas Broke Truce
Israel Strikes Targets In Gaza, Suspends Aid After Accusing Hamas Of Violating Ceasefire
summary: Israel launched over 20 air strikes on Gaza, targeting "dozens" of sites after alleging Palestinian militants attacked its troops with gunfire and an anti-tank missile in Rafah. Despite the violence, both Israel and Hamas claim to remain committed to a ceasefire established about a week prior. Hamas, however, has stated it was unaware of the initial clashes that prompted the Israeli response.

title: Trail Blazers Extend Sharpe and Camara in $172M Deal
snippets: The Trail Blazers agreed to four-year extension with both guard Shaedon Sharpe ($90 million) and forward Toumani Camara ($82 mllion), their agents told ESPN.
The Trail Blazers have locked up two members of their young, developing core
This locks up two key players the Portland Trail Blazers see as part of their future.
titles: Agents: Blazers' Sharpe, Camara reach extensions
Trail Blazers agree to contract extensions with Shaedon Sharpe, Toumani Camara, per reports
Portland reaches extensions with Shaedon Sharpe (4 years, $90 million), Toumani Camara (4 years, $82 million)
summary: The Portland Trail Blazers have secured four-year extensions for guard Shaedon Sharpe ($90 million) and forward Toumani Camara ($82 million), as confirmed by their agents to ESPN. This move ensures that two essential members of their young core will remain with the team, highlighting the Trail Blazers' commitment to their future development.

title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies at 36
snippets: Doug Martin, a former Boise State star who went on to be an All-Pro running back for the Buccaneers, has died, his family said in a statement Sunday. He was 36.
The 'Muscle Hamster' made two Pro Bowls over his seven-year NFL career

titles: RB Martin, former All-Pro with Bucs, dies at 36

summary: Doug Martin, a former Boise State star and All-Pro NFL running back for the Buccaneers, has died at 36, his family announced. Known as 'Muscle Hamster,' Martin made two Pro Bowls during his seven-year career.

title: Jewels Stolen from Louvre in Seven-Minute Heist, Security Concerns Raised
snippets: Thieves have stolen priceless jewels from the Louvre in Paris, in a brazen heist that only took minutes.
France's Interior Ministry said jewels of "inestimable value" were taken from the world-renowned museum in a seven-minute heist.
What to know about the heist at Paris' Louvre museum Axios
Thieves broke into the museum's Galerie d'Apollon and made off with "priceless" jewelry, French interior minister Laurent Nuñez said.

summary: Thieves stole jewels of "inestimable value" from the Galerie d'Apollon in Paris' Louvre Museum in a swift seven-minute heist, according to France's Interior Ministry and Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez. The incident has highlighted significant security concerns at the world-renowned museum.

title: Limp Bizkit Bassist Sam Rivers Dies at 48
snippets: "Sam Rivers wasn't just our bass player — he was pure magic. The pulse beneath every song, the calm in the chaos, the soul in the sound," Limp Bizkit said in a social media post Saturday.

Nu-metal group says Rivers ‘brought a light and a rhythm that could never be replaced’ Sam Rivers, the bassist and backing vocalist of the US nu-metal group Limp Bizkit, has died at the age of 48, the band has said. Limp Bizkit announced the death in a social media post, describing Rivers as the ban

Sam Rivers, the bass player in the band Limp Bizkit, died on Saturday, according to social media posts by his bandmates. The band did not disclose where Rivers died or the circumstances, but praised him as “pure magic” and “the soul in the sound.” “From the first note we ever played together, Sam br
titles: Sam Rivers, bassist and founding member of Limp Bizkit, dies aged 48
Limp Bizkit announces death of bassist Sam Rivers aged 48
Limp Bizkit band members say bass player Sam Rivers has died
summary: Sam Rivers, the bassist and backing vocalist for the nu-metal band Limp Bizkit, has passed away at the age of 48. His death was announced by the band in a social media post, where they praised him as "pure magic," the driving force behind their music, and irreplaceable. The band did not disclose the cause or location of his death.

title: Tel Aviv Derby Cancelled Amid Riots and Safety Fears; Nine Arrested
snippets: The derby between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Hapoel Tel Aviv is cancelled before kick-off after police say "smoke grenades and pyrotechnic devices were thrown".

Israeli police make nine arrests, citing ‘disorderly conduct, riots, injured police officers’ and infrastructure damage The Tel Aviv football derby between Hapoel and Maccabi has been called off after rioting and “risks to human life”, Israeli police said. The match was due to take place on Sunday n

The soccer derby between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Hapoel Tel Aviv was called off Sunday after disturbances before kickoff led police to determine it was unsafe to go ahead. Trouble flared in and around Bloomfield Stadium, which is shared by both clubs, ahead of the Israeli Premier League match. The Jeru
titles: Tel Aviv derby called off by police after 'violent riots'
Tel Aviv football derby between Hapoel and Maccabi called off after rioting
Israeli Premier League soccer derby between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Hapoel Tel Aviv called off
summary: The Tel Aviv football derby between Maccabi Tel Aviv and Hapoel Tel Aviv was cancelled before kickoff due to safety concerns after smoke grenades and pyrotechnic devices were thrown, leading to riots and injuries. Israeli police arrested nine individuals for disorderly conduct, riots, injuring police officers, and damaging infrastructure. The disturbances occurred around Bloomfield Stadium, shared by both teams, prompting police to deem the event unsafe.

title: Verstappen Wins US Grand Prix, Tightens Championship Race
snippets: Max Verstappen dominates the United States Grand Prix to increase the pressure on McLaren drivers Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris in the championship.

Lando Norris overtakes Charles Leclerc to finish second Piastri manages fifth with rivals closing in on title lead Dominant, untouchable and bearing a broad, beaming grin in the Texas sunshine, the transformation in Max Verstappen after he took victory at the US Grand Prix could not have been starke

Norris managed to finish second by overtaking Charles Leclerc, while Piastri finished fifth, with competitors narrowing the gap in the title lead.

title: North Korean Soldier Defects to South Korea, First Since August 2024
snippets: The incident is the first alleged defection of a North Korean soldier in more than a year.

The military took custody of the soldier who crossed the central porti

SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A North Korean soldier defected to South Korea across the rivals’ heavily fortified border on Sunday, South Korea’s military said. The military took the custody of the soldier who crossed the central portion of the land border, South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a
titles: South Korea arrests North Korean soldier for crossing fortified border
North Korean soldier defects to South Korea across heavily fortified border
North Korean soldier defects to South Korea across the rivals’ heavily fortified border
summary: A North Korean soldier defected to South Korea by crossing the heavily fortified border, marking the first reported defection since August 2024. South Korea's military confirmed they have taken custody of the soldier who crossed the central portion of the border.

Israel strikes targets in Gaza and halts the arrival of aid after it said Hamas militants fired on Israeli troops.

summary: Israel launched airstrikes in Gaza and stopped all aid after claiming Hamas attacked its soldiers, killing two. Despite the escalation, both sides affirm their commitment to a ceasefire.

title: Rail Conductor Killed by Train in Columbus, Montana; NTSB Investigating
snippets: The incident occurred at about 9:40 a.m. in Columbus, a town of about 2,000 people 40 miles southwest of Billings.

COLUMBUS, Montana (AP) — Authorities were investigating the death of a rail conductor who was hit by a passing train Sunday in Montana, the National Transportation Safety Board said. The conductor worked for BNSF Railway, the agency said in a post on the social media site X. BNSF Railway operates on
titles: Death of BNSF Railway conductor who was hit by a passing train is under investigation
Authorities investigate the death of a rail conductor who was struck by a train in Montana
summary: In Columbus, Montana, a rail conductor employed by BNSF Railway was fatally struck by a passing train at around 9:40 a.m. The incident, which occurred in a town approximately 40 miles southwest of Billings with a population of about 2,000, is under investigation by the National Transportation Safety Board, as announced in a statement on X.

title: Turkish Cypriots Elect New Leader, Renew Hope for Cyprus Talks

title: Houthi Rebels Detain 20 UN Staff in Yemen, 11 Released
snippets: United Nations demands the release of its employees after Houthi forces raided a facility and detained staff in Sanaa.

Five Yemenis and 15 foreign workers held as Iran-backed group steps up its campaign against international agencies Houthi rebels have detained 20 employees at a UN facility in Sana’a, the capital of Yemen. They are holding five Yemenis and 15 international workers but released another 11 after quest
titles: Yemen’s Houthis detain 20 UN staff in latest raid
Houthi rebels detain 20 UN staff in Yemen
summary: Houthi rebels in Sana'a, Yemen, detained 20 UN employees, including 5 Yemenis and 15 international workers, after raiding a UN facility. The Iran-backed group later released 11 of those detained. The United Nations has demanded the immediate release of its staff.

title: Zelenskiy: Peace Talks Require Conflict Freeze at Current Lines
snippets: Zelenskiy Wants Ukraine War to Be Frozen Before Peace Talks Bloomberg.com

Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy says the war with Russia should be frozen along current battle lines before the two sides can enter into peace negotiations, even as Vladimir Putin continues to demand that Ukraine cede the entire Donetsk region in the east to Russia.
titles: Zelenskiy Wants Ukraine War to Be Frozen Before Peace Talks - Bloomberg.com
Zelenskiy Wants Ukraine War to Be Frozen Before Peace Talks
summary: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has stated that for peace talks with Russia to occur, the conflict must first be frozen at the current front lines. This stance comes amidst demands from Russian President Vladimir Putin for Ukraine to surrender the entire Donetsk region.

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — Iran executed a person convicted of spying for Israel’s intelligence agency Mossad in the city of Qom, the official judiciary news agency reported Sunday. The sentence was carried out early Saturday after the Supreme Court upheld the ruling and a request for a pard

Iran executes person accused of spying for Israel
